questions.question: I may be blunt …………………… at least I am honest.
questions.description: We use but to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: She is beautiful …………………. she squints a little.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He was …………………….. tired that he could barely stand.
questions.description: The conjunction so...that... shows cause and effect.

questions.question: You will get the award ……………………… you deserve it.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: You will not get the job ………………….. you succeed in the interview.
questions.description: Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: ……………………… she is of noble birth, she is not rich.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: …………………….. there is life, there is hope.
questions.description: All of these can be used here with slightly different meanings.

questions.question: ……………………… you have apologized, I will not sack you.
questions.description: All of these words indicate the reason.

questions.question: …………………….. he was the most deserving candidate, they appointed him.
Generally speaking, the houses in ……………………… the Burmese live are made of bamboo.
He kept quiet …………………….. the argument might stop.
……………………… he was sick, he stayed at home.
